establishment.name: Motor City Casino - Assembly Line Buffet

properties.name: Motor City Casino - Assembly Line Buffet

nearbyList.name: Det. Delta Prep. Acad for Social Justice

violationsByInspectionidList.violationDescription:
If raw, raw-marinated, partially cooked, or marinated-partially cooked FISH are served or sold in READY-TO-EAT form, the PERSON IN CHARGE shall record the freezing temperature and time to which the FISH are subjected and shall retain the records at the FOOD ESTABLISHMENT for 90 calendar days beyond the time of service or sale of the FISH. (Pf)
If the FISH are frozen by a supplier, a written agreement or statement from the supplier stipulating that the FISH supplied are frozen to a temperature and for a time specified by law.
violationsByInspectionidList.problemDescription: Not maintained for 90 days beyond time of sale

violationsByInspectionidList.violationDescription: A PLUMBING SYSTEM shall be installed to preclude backflow of contaminants into the water supply system at each point of use at the FOOD ESTABLISHMENT by providing an air gap or installing an APPROVED backflow prevention device. (P)

If raw, raw-marinated, partially cooked, or marinated-partially cooked FISH are served or sold in READY-TO-EAT form, the PERSON IN CHARGE shall record the freezing temperature and time to which the FISH are subjected and shall retain the records at the FOOD ESTABLISHMENT for 90 calendar days beyond the time of service or sale of the FISH. (Pf)
If the FISH are frozen by a supplier, a written agreement or statement from the supplier stipulating that the FISH supplied are frozen to a temperature and for a time specified by law.
violationsByInspectionidList.problemDescription: Not maintained for 90 days beyond time of sale

violationsByInspectionidList.violationDescription:
During pauses in FOOD preparation or dispensing, UTENSILS shall be stored:
(A) In the FOOD with their handles above the top of the FOOD and the container;
(B) In FOOD that is not POTENTIALLY HAZARDOUS with their handles above the      top of the FOOD within containers or EQUIPMENT that can be closed, such as      bins of sugar, flour, or cinnamon;
(C) On a clean portion of the FOOD preparation table or cooking EQUIPMENT
(D)  In running water, such as dipper well.
(E)  In a clean, protected location if the UTENSILS, such as ice scoops, are   used only with a FOOD that is not POTENTIALLY HAZARDOUS; or
(F)  In a container of water maintained at a temperature of at least 135° F.
EQUIPMENT shall be maintained in a state of repair and condition that meets the requirements of the code.
Light of the proper intensity shall be provided as specified.

Except during preparation, cooking, or cooling, or when time is used as the public health control POTENTIALLY HAZARDOUS FOOD (TIME/TEMPERATURE CONTROL FOR SAFETY FOOD) shall be maintained:
(A)  135ºF or above, except that roasts properly cooked and cooled may be held              at a temperature of 130ºF; or (P)
(B)   At 41ºF or less (P)

(A) A HANDWASHING SINK shall be maintained so that it is accessible at all times for EMPLOYEE use and used for no other purpose. (Pf)
(B)  An automatic handwashing facility shall be used in accordance with manufacturer's instructions. (Pf)
violationsByInspectionidList.correctionDescription: Remove items from handsink.  Do not store items at handsink.

violationsByInspectionidList.violationDescription: Products that are held by the PERMIT HOLDER for credit, redemption, or return to the distributor, such as damaged, spoiled, or recalled products, shall be segregated and held in designated areas that are separated from FOOD, EQUIPMENT, UTENSILS, LINENS, and SINGLE-SERVICE and SINGLE-USE ARTICLES.(Pf)
violationsByInspectionidList.correctionDescription: Provide adequate separation to prevent contamination.

violationsByInspectionidList.violationDescription:
(A) A HANDWASHING SINK shall be maintained so that it is accessible at all times for EMPLOYEE use and used for no other purpose. (Pf)
(B)  An automatic handwashing facility shall be used in accordance with manufacturer's instructions. (Pf)
violationsByInspectionidList.correctionDescription: Remove items from handsink.  Do not store items at handsink.

violationsByInspectionidList.violationDescription: Exhaust ventilation hood systems in FOOD preparation and WAREWASHING areas including components such as hoods, fans, guards, and ducting shall be designed to prevent grease or condensation from draining or dripping onto FOOD, EQUIPMENT, UTENSILS, LINENS, and SINGLE-SERVICE and SINGLE-USE ARTICLES.
violationsByInspectionidList.problemDescription: Designed to allow grease or condensation from draining/dripping onto

violationsByInspectionidList.violationDescription:
A PLUMBING SYSTEM shall be:
(A) Repaired according to LAW; (P) and
(B) Maintained in good repair.
violationsByInspectionidList.problemDescription: Not constructed, designed, installed according to law
violationsByInspectionidList.correctionDescription: Remove and replace to be in compliance with law.
